definition: goose feather sent from afar (idiom); a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it/also written 千里送鵝毛|千里送鹅毛

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
lit. the mountains crumble and the trees lie ruined/a great sage has died (idiom)
to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
ink slab and sitting mat/place where one studies and teaches
feelings deeper than for one's own flesh and blood (idiom)/deep friendship
to compete to produce extravagant literary works (idiom)
drumming on a bowl in grief (idiom, refers to Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 grieving for his lost wife)/fig. grief for a lost wife
to cast away/to reject/to shun/to desert one's post
butchering one another as fish and flesh (idiom); killing one another/internecine strife
